questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a semi-colon?

choices.answer: When I go outside; the sun shines like a lamp.
After school today; I'll be going on a run.
It's going to be a long week; at least next week is short.
I'm going to buy; apples, oranges, and pears.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the commas correctly?

choices.answer: I want to buy, books, tea, and chocolate.
I want to buy books, tea and chocolate.
I, want to buy, books, tea, and chocolate.
I want to buy books, tea, and chocolate.

questions.question: Which sentence uses a colon correctly?

choices.answer: I need a few items at the store: tea, chocolate, and cheese.
This weekend I'm going to: sleep, eat, and watch football.
When it's cold outside: I wear a sweater.

questions.question: What does a semi colon do?

choices.answer: It links an independent and a dependent clause.
It links two independent clauses.
It takes care of the Oxford comma problem.

questions.question: Which sentence uses a comma correctly?

choices.answer: You like Fridays, don't you?
You, like Fridays, don't you?
You like Fridays don't you?
"It's great" he said.
"It's great," he said.
"It's great", he said.

questions.question: What is the rule with FANBOYS and commas?

choices.answer: Put a comma after a FANBOY between and Ind. & Dep. Clause.
Link two independent clauses with a comma then a FANBOY

questions.question: Which sentence uses all punctuation correctly?

choices.answer: I like Paris, France; Istanbul, Turkey; and Sienna, Italy.
I like Durban, South Africa: and Auckland, New Zealand.
I like Africa, Europe and Asia.

questions.question: Which formula for a semi-colon is correct?

choices.answer: IC;DC
DC;IC
IC;IC

questions.question: Which sentence uses a semi-colon correctly?

choices.answer: It was only a 4-day week; sometimes shorter weeks are crazy.
When we go to Europe; I want to see Paris.
Because it was cold; I wore a jacket and hat.

questions.question: What is the "formula" for using a colon?

choices.answer: IC:DC
IC:IC
DC:IC

questions.question: Which sentence uses a colon correctly?

choices.answer: I really like: cookies, brownies, and cake.
I like this quote: "An unexamined life is not worth living."
Once upon a time: there was a little boy named Carl.
I despise work: I just want to sleep all day.
Frogs are my favorite animal; they're a fascinating species.
I need to make: muffins, coffee cake, & cocoa.
